aroma.notes: Hard to say. Mostly the smell of steam with a hint of tangy fruit. No 'burnt' smell.

sweetness.notes: More present in the fruit note, like the difference between a cherry and cherry cough syrup.

finish.notes: Shorter than the last several cups, but it is pleasantly warm and barely acidic.

flavor: Wow. In spite (or because) of the long drawdown, this is easily the most luscious, full-bodied, three-dimensional, balanced cup from these beans. The fruit note is not overwhelming like last time and is well-balanced with sweetness, the finish just 'melts', no astringency. However, the taste decreases as the coffee cools.
notes: Water was already draining very slowly by the time I filled to the top. I did a generous swirl and tap twice, not sure that was a good idea, but it did finish without stalling.
actionItem: Try one more time at 24. Research what the diminishing taste on cooldown warrants.
